title: Do liars make good storytellers? - Quora

response.answer_text: The great ones sure do. Here’s Rule #1: The power of storytelling rests in the specifics. Great storytellers are able to pack their stories with specifics that seduce the listener. Listen to the details of con men and serial killers — it’s their most common attribute — the ability to seduce their audience with specifics. In fact, just last night on 60 Minutes they had a great segment on “The Theranos Deception” — all about Elizabeth Holmes who built an entire billion dollar biotech company based on lies and fabrication. Every time she would get cornered she would dive into more specifics of all the breakthroughs they were having, seducing the skeptics with the specifics. The wheels have come off her cart, but not before spinning endless lies and even still she continues to raise money despite all the exposing of her fraud. Another perfect example of this trait is the popular recent 6 part podcast “Dirty John” from the LA Times. That was exactly the deal with John — a con man from Orange County. He spun out lies that were so specific people couldn’t help but believe them. You hear the women he seduced telling about this — they just couldn’t believe what he was saying wasn’t true — it was all so full of details and sounded so real and convincing.
